title: Lake Erie
summary: Lake Erie (/ˈɪəri/; French: Lac Érié) is the fourth largest lake (by surface area) of the five Great Lakes in North America and the eleventh-largest globally.[6][10] It is the southernmost, shallowest, and smallest by volume of the Great Lakes[11][12] and therefore also has the shortest average water residence time. At its deepest point Lake Erie is 210 feet (64 metres) deep.
